definition: to speak in a pleasant and captivating manner (idiom)
active/comply with
active/comply with
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: What has been your charge for repeating this very plausible story?
sentences.chinese: 你复述这个娓娓动听的故事，得到了多少酬劳？

sentences.english: He is good at telling stories, and can attract the attention of all the children.
sentences.chinese: 他讲起故事来娓娓动听，吸引了所有小朋友的注意力。

sentences.english: Her performance was pleasing, though by no means capital.
sentences.chinese: 她的表演虽然说不上奇妙绝伦，也还娓娓动听。

sentences.english: It has been said that Thoreau's style is conversational.
sentences.chinese: 有人说梭罗的文章娓娓动听。

sentences.english: She can dish up the story in a humorous way.
sentences.chinese: 她能幽默地把这故事讲得娓娓动听。

sentences.english: The teacher dished up the story in a humorous way.
sentences.chinese: 老师以幽默风趣的语调，把故事讲得娓娓动听。

sentences.english: This story was told in a pleasant and interesting way.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事讲得娓娓动听。

definition: (of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
pleasant to listen to
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
(voice, music) suave/mellow/(speech) indirect/tactful
soul-stirring (of drama, poem or artwork)/heart-rending/deeply moving
see 一倡三歎|一倡三叹[yi1 chang4 san1 tan4]
melodious/mellifluous
sweet-sounding/beautiful (of sound)
sparkling with wit (idiom)
sparkling with wit (idiom)
to enchant/fascinating
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
